def_cn: (敏捷地)抱起，拿起，捡起,拽过来
def_en: If you scoop a person or thing somewhere, you put your hands or arms under or round them and quickly move them there.
If you scoop something from a container, you remove it with something such as a spoon.
A scoop is an object like a spoon which is used for picking up a quantity of a food such as ice cream or an ingredient such as flour.

def_cn: 抢先报道的新闻;独家新闻
def_en: You can use scoop to refer to an exciting news story which is reported in one newspaper or on one television programme before it appears anywhere else.
If a newspaper scoops other newspapers, it succeeds in printing an exciting or important story before they do.

def_cn: 获取，赢得，捧走(奖金或奖项)
def_en: If you scoop a prize or award, you win it.

def_cn: (衣领)汤匙式的，大圆领的
def_en: If something such as a dress has a scoop neck or a scooped neck, the neck has the shape of a wide, deep curve at the front.
